snippet: Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan of New York said that the Roman Catholic Church could be more open to gay men and lesbians, but that it would not change its teachings.
abstract: Cardinal Timothy M Dolan of New York, in television interviews, says Roman Catholic Church could be more welcoming of gay men and lesbians, even if it opposes same-sex marriage; Dolan stresses church's teaching that marriage is between one man and one woman should not be reduced to attack on gay people.
lead_paragraph: Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan of New York said that the Roman Catholic Church could be more open to gay men and lesbians, but that it would not change its teachings.

headline.seo: Dolan Says Church Should Be More Welcoming of Gay People
headline.main: Dolan Says the Catholic Church Should Be More Welcoming to Gay People
headline.print_headline: Dolan Says the Catholic Church Should Be More Welcoming to Gay People

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
